synth.name: Digitakt

steps: Exit Grid Recording mode
Select the pattern to copy from
Press <synth-button>FUNC</synth-button> and <synth-button narrow>⏺</synth-button> to copy the pattern
Selec the pattern to copy to
Press <synth-button>FUNC</synth-button> and <synth-button narrow>⏹️</synth-button> to paste the pattern
Exit Grid Recording mode
Select the pattern to clear
Press <synth-button>FUNC</synth-button> and <synth-button narrow>▶️</synth-button> to clear the pattern's trigs
Press <synth-button>YES</synth-button> and <synth-button>PAGE</synth-button> to activate fills for the next repetition of the pattern
Hold <synth-button>PAGE</synth-button> to activate fills immediately while held down
Press <synth-button>YES</synth-button> and <synth-button>PAGE</synth-button>, release <synth-button>YES</synth-button>, then release <synth-button>PAGE</synth-button> to latch Fill Mode
Press <synth-button>PAGE</synth-button> to unlatch Fill Mode
Hold down <synth-button>TRIG</synth-button> step(s) to lock trigs, or don't to affect track

details: Played only when in fill mode
Played when not in fill mode
Trigger A times out of B repeats of the pattern
Play if most previous condition was true
Played when most previous condition not true
Play only the first time the pattern is looped
Play always, exception the first time the pattern is looped
Play if most previous condition on track-1 was true
Played when most previous condition on track-1 not true

steps: Press <synth-button narrow>⏺</synth-button> to enter recording mode
Hold down <synth-button>TRIG</synth-button> for the step(s) to remove
Press the <synth-knob>DATA ENTRY</synth-knob> knob for the parameter to remove
Press and hold <synth-button>TRK</synth-button>
Adjust any parameter and it adjusts for all audio tracks
Press <synth-button>NO</synth-button> to revert changes
Release <synth-button>TRK</synth-button>
Press <synth-button narrow>⏺</synth-button> and <synth-button narrow>⏹️</synth-button> to enter step recording mode
Press a <synth-button>TRIG</synth-button> key to indicate where to start recording
Research more because this is a nightmare
Press and hold any <synth-button>TRIG</synth-button> keys
Press <synth-button>↑</synth-button> or <synth-button>↓</synth-button> to open menu
“Retrig” must be on
Press <synth-button>↑</synth-button> or <synth-button>↓</synth-button> to change the rate, with <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>16</sub> being no retriggering
research more -- this is complicated
Press <synth-button>FUNC</synth-button> and <synth-button>PAGE</synth-button> to enter the scale menu
Change scale as needed. 1x are <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>16</sub> notes, 2x are <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>32</sub> notes, <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>2</sub>x are <sup>1</sup>⁄<sub>8</sub> notes, etc.

notes: Almost everything (including tempo and audio routing) is per pattern, so add patterns by copying one with the settings you want
MIDI Outputs for the audio channels send CC only, not notes

midi.notes: MIDI Channel must be changed in MIDI Control Center
